intro: Cleome ornithopodioides subsp. donetzica, commonly known as the Donetz cleome, is a flowering plant native to parts of Eastern Europe and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
